nodes.full_text: @heydonworks When you declare an array type, you need to specify what the array consists of, like Array<string> (or Array<any> if you want a temp placeholder until you figure out what it is, or make another interface for IObject with its own properties and then declare Array<IObject>, etc)

nodes.full_text: @heydonworks strictPropertyInitialization might have something to do with it being sometimes required and not. If that is false in the tsconfig, thing: boolean; would be ok. Otherwise, you would need to provide a default value, use the ?: syntax, or boolean | undefined as the type
